description: This file serves as a stand-alone HTTP server handling HNAP requests, primarily for device configuration or management purposes. It includes functions for parsing HTTP headers, handling authentication, and managing network socket communication. It also contains a main loop that sets up socket binding, listens for incoming connections, and delegates request processing.

methods.name: void HTTP_ParseHeaders(FILE * pfh,char * pszBuf,unsigned int cbBuf,int * pGet,char ** ppszLocation,unsigned int * pContentLength,char ** ppszSoapAction,char ** ppszAuth)
methods.description: Parses HTTP request headers from a file stream to extract method, location, content length, SOAP action, and authorization headers.

methods.name: int HTTP_AuthDecode(char * pszHTTPAuth,char * pszAuthBuf,unsigned int cbAuthBuf,char ** ppszUsername,char ** ppszPassword)
methods.description: Decodes the Basic HTTP authorization header to extract username and password.

methods.name: void HTTP_HandleRequest(FILE * pfhRead,FILE * pfhWrite)
methods.description: Handles an incoming HTTP request: parsing headers, authenticating, and delegating to the HDK request handler.

methods.name: void alarm_handler(int signal)
methods.description: Signal handler for SIGALRM to perform specific timeout handling related to home security Ethernet port.

methods.name: int main(int argc,char * argv[])
methods.description: Main entry point of the program: initializes socket, binds to interface, listens for incoming connections, and processes requests in an infinite loop.
